Package hw7

Class mergeSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw7.mergeSort
  • public class mergeSort
extends java.lang.Object
    mergeSort class that sorts a map by count of characters.

      • merge_sort

        public void merge_sort​(int[] values,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aux,
                       int left,
                       int right)
        This is a recursive merge sort algorithm that sorts an array of integers.
        Parameters:
        values - an array of integers that needs to be sorted using the merge sort algorithm.
        aux - The "aux" parameter is an ArrayList of Strings that is used as an auxiliary array during the merge sort algorithm. It is used to temporarily store the sorted values during the merging process.
        left - The index of the leftmost element in the array or subarray being sorted.
        right - The index of the rightmost element in the array or subarray being sorted.

      • merge

        public void merge​(int[] values,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aux,
                  int low,
                  int mid,
                  int high)
        This method merges two subarrays of an array based on their values.
        Parameters:
        values - an integer array that needs to be sorted using merge sort algorithm
        aux - The "aux" parameter is an ArrayList of Strings that contains auxiliary information related to the "values" array being sorted.
        low - The starting index of the subarray.
        mid - The index representing the end of the first subarray and the start of the second subarray.
        high - The index of the last element in the subarray.

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        This method prints the original map and the sorted map.
